boat.full_description:
Designed and built in my home workshop from 2024-25, as my ultimate do-it-all dinghy, and to break long-standing sailing records, demonstrating that traditional rigs and hull forms are still be relevant.

The intention is to attempt the non-stop round Britain in an open boat record in summer 2026.

Combining modern materials with decades of experience sailing and working on all kinds of traditional and modern, high-perfomance boats, Ræedwald is designed to be as versatile and user-friendly as possible. She has 2 mast steps and 5 rig configurations, including a single balanced lug rig, lug yawl rig(with tent for camping), cruising gaff rig, high-performance gaff rig (with trapeze), and "cat-boat style" single gaff mainsail.

She is constructed in plywood and carbon fibre, with an entirely carbon fibre rig. This makes her very light and strong, whilst maintening a traditional, clinker aesthetic.

The boat is self-draining, even in the unlikely event of being entirely swamped. She has generous freeboard and a huge amount of integrated buoyancy. This makes her a very safe coastal cruising boat.
She also has optional water ballast tanks beneath the cockpit sole, adding upto 70kg of ballast, making her virtually uncapsizeable!

I have taken moulds of the hull and interior to produce further double-skinned, cored grp hulls, if there is interest.
boat.name: Rædwald
boat.short_description: A new spirit of tradition, high-performance sailing dinghy.
